alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Central Piscataquis; Northern Penobscot; Southern Penobscot; Southern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A line of thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Piscataquis and central Penobscot Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 944 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms near Brownville Junction, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph heavy downpours and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lincoln, Dover-Foxcroft, Dexter, Howland, Brownville Junction, Milo, Medway, Orneville, Licoln Township, Ebeemee, Grand Falls, Lake View Plantation, Enfield, Greenbush, Charleston, Sangerville, Bradford, Brownville, Garland and Lee. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 206 and 242. State Highway 11 between Milo and West Seboeis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
